title: Wall Street vet dunks on Suze Orman’s ‘peeing $1 million down the drain’ take
text:
Earlier this year, Suze Orman, with a net worth well into eight figures, said she wouldn’t insult herself by buying a daily cup of coffee.

“You are peeing $1 million down the drain as you are drinking that coffee,” she said. “Do you really want to do that? No.”

According to her math, that extra $3 a day spent on a caffeine fix could balloon into $1 million after 40 years in a Roth IRA.

Read: This is ‘the stupidest comment’ Orman has ever read

But without pointing specifically at Orman, Sallie Krawcheck, the longtime Wall Street exec who now runs Ellevest, tells CNBC the idea that we should skip our daily coffee is “terrible advice” and there are “layers of things” wrong with it.

Here’s just one of those layers:

‘We’re sitting here talking about lattes, when, with young women, we really do need to acknowledge the gender pay gap that exists. Our efforts need to be put into changing the inequities, as opposed to making people feel this sense of guilt and shame over having a lovely cup of coffee in the morning.’

Along with the bigger-picture issues that she believes the younger generation should be more focused on, Krawcheck also talked about the practical matters of how to approach savings. She pointed to the 50-30-20 formula: 50% on income to your needs, 30% to the fun stuff and 20% to savings.

“We’re only on this earth a short amount of time,” she said. “We need to have fun.”
